alert.note: Alert for Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 15 at 9:47PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues. * WHERE...The Yukon River At Stevens Village. * WHEN...Until 600 PM AKDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of low lying areas near Stevens Village is occuring. Water is now rising rapidly and moving over the bank. Water has moved up to 2 cabins, and is expected to continue rising tonight. Many of the cabins in Stevens Village could be surrounded by water and possibly flood. Moderate to major flooding is possible. Large blocks of ice could push onshore. Water will remain high until the ice jam releases. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 915 PM AKDT, An employee at the Yukon river Bridge reports that people in Stevens Village had called to report that water has been rising rapidly the past several hours and that water is over the bank and up to two cabins. The same employee reports that ice remain solidly in place from the Yukon River bridge upstream. Earlier today the River Watch Team reported a forty mile long run of bank-to-bank ice and high water approaching Stevens Village with strong in-place ice downriver at the start of the canyon. It is expected that the ice and high water that was moving downstream earlier today is now jammed up against the ice that remains in place in the canyon, and is backing water up into Stevens Village. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood - If you live near or along the Yukon River river at Stevens Village, move to high ground or to the.
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life.
